website_summaries.verdict: The Micca MB42's classy, compact design makes it a top budget speaker when style counts, although Monoprice's MBS-650 sound better for even less.
pros: The Micca MB42s have an unusually stylish and compact design for budget bookshelf speakers
Build quality feels better than average, including binding posts instead of spring clips for connecting speaker wire
And the sound quality is good for the price and size of the speakers
cons: Larger budget speakers sound better for the same price

customer_reviews.title: Price =/= Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality center channel speaker! Everything from the cabinet finish to the post free magnetic grill, all of it says quality! As for the sound? Pretty good so far. Very clear and somewhat full range. I'm thinking it needs some burn in time. I will say, the two drivers have no problem moving when bass is present which tells me they should open up once there used a bit. I have the speaker sitting on top of my 55" Samsung if you wanted and idea of size, see pics.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO Great, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Y'all, these speakers are freaking AMAZING for the price. I wanted small, bookshelf sized speakers to use with both my TV and my record player, and these REALLY do the trick. When I first wired them to my stereo receiver (I have an ONKYO TX-8020), the speakers sounded a bit tinny, but I adjusted the levels and they sound so full and beautiful. My friends come over to watch movies and they can't BELIEVE how amazing they sound coming out of these small speakers. I love the way my records sound through them too. You will NOT be disappointed in these! Give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: JenniLynn

customer_reviews.title: good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up. 16 gauge speaker wire and they were putting out a wall of sound. I have a Onkyo receiver that has to be 30 years old. I have a audio techniques turntable that I am also impresses with. I do not care for the bluetooth stuff yet. I used to own JBL speakers that weighed about 60 pounds. They had massive magnets. These Micca Mb42 speakers fit on me chester drawers. I have Ar3a speakers that I do not think are made anymore. I put on Alterbridges new album and it was like being in a concert. Very impressed with these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: zag186

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: not bad sounding but, had an issue. no sound came out TRIED contacting customer service, an exercise in futility, and they give you the biggest run around. The speakers stopped working a month in. Due to another review I purchased another cord and that solved our problem. Would not purchase again as they dodge any request for help. emailed 12 times. they send same email for request for info then ignore you.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Movies, Yes. Music, Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: I used these for music for a while. I thought they were pretty good for their size. Then I purchased Polk's cheapest bookshelf speakers. The difference was evident. These are much harsher in the high ranges and bass is lacking, mostly due to woofer size. I have since relegated them to a small 5.1 system in the living room. Here they really shine. The harshness isn't really noticed and they're great for action movies. Get something a bit bigger for music. You'll definitely appreciate something with smoother highs.
customer_reviews.author: myJimpants

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little speaker for a small to medium sized room. If you want it to be really loud look elsewhere. Don't get me wrong this thing held its own over some much larger speakers when I was testing it. For such small drivers it puts out incredible sound with unbeatable bass response. With that being said, the room I tried it in was rather large and it just wouldn't get loud enough. So if you want it for a smaller sized room this thing is the way to go for clear dialogue with great bass response. Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: Phill1728

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with these speakers -- thanks Amazon reviewers !!
customer_reviews.text: In addition to our main hi fi system, I have a small two speaker stereo system based on Sony SS B1000 bookshelf speakers driven by a class D amp. My wife asked me to put together one for her work area but needed smaller speaker size for portability. I found these Micca MB42 speakers on Amazon and decided to give them a try based upon the reviews. After listening to both side-by-side, I cannot tell the difference despite the smaller size of the Micca product. The Micca MB42 speakers produce outstanding sound quality with the class D amp I'm using.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago John

customer_reviews.title: Power adapter screams when plugged in like it will explode
customer_reviews.text: Power adapter screams when plugged in like it will explode. Had speakers for many months while it worked fine, one day out of random - the adapter included in the speaker started making loud screech noises when the speakers were plugged in. This is very concerning. A new adapter online on amazon is 20 dollars too. Horrible deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In a bookshelf, the bass is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after trying the Mackie CR speakers. Those didn't work as I explained in that review. These are amazing. I have used the small COVO-s speakers as rear surrounds for several years, so I am familiar with the Micca products. These are not listed as "reference" speakers, but they certainly are. I have them in a bookshelf, above my computer desk, where the bass port really does its job. I have used them for a month and like them more each day. I like them so much, I purchased the passive version to replace my COVO-s speakers on my main system.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Look for another set of speakers
customer_reviews.text: This set came with a hyped sound description. Lamentably, they did not live up to their hype. Now, i wasn't expecting the quality of other notable and reputable companies that have higher prices for their products. However, this 2 speaker set was a complete disappointment. The overall sound is very tame and recesses over analog sound. The fact they charged what they did was insulting. I've never given a poor review of an item that was deserving but, I'd be remiss if i hadn't in this case. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: mark hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Real Center Speaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a real speaker and is perfect for a center channel. It's getting hard to find a speaker that isn't "smart" and complicates your life with another remote and blu-this and wi-that. This is a speaker. Two wires. Good sound. I'm using it with a Onkyo 7.1 receiver and am completly happy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great price, not the best build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm super demanding about sound systems and being myself an audio engineer, I can tell this speakers sound surprisingly good, much better than several better known brands that cost twice as much at least. Only problem I see is with build quality. A couple of the pins that hold the grills in place came off after a while and I noticed the cloth itself is held on the back of the grill very poorly and can be unglued with very little effort. Anyone who doesn't know how bad it is glued may accidentally ruin it completely.
customer_reviews.author: okar LB

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I owned and loved a pair of mb42x’s in the past, so getting these was a no brainer. I didn’t even look around at what else was on the market. Sadly the pb42x’s don’t seem to be up to the same quality standard as their passive sibling - the pair I got is dead on arrival, probably due to some problem with the amp and not the speakers themselves based on the steady tick... tick... tick coming from just the right hand unit. Very disappointed, will be seeking a refund and probably looking around at what else there is at this price point. May be a good idea to keep the amplifier outside of the speaker cabinet after all.
customer_reviews.author: Max Miner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound
customer_reviews.text: I finally replaced some really old Labtec (Logitech bought Labtec in 2001 so yeah, they were old) PC speakers with these. The Labtecs had good sound but these were a major step up. I haven't put them through the paces but so far the frequency response seems to be flat as it should be for a pair of monitors. The 15 watts per channel is more than adequate for listening to music while I work and if I choose to crank them up, the sound remains clean without distortion. They won't shake the house with deep bass but Micca specifications indicate frequency response down to 60 Hz and that is probably as good as you will find without a subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: CoolGeek

customer_reviews.title: A very worthwhile surprise!
customer_reviews.text: The only con is that it's a fairly large unit. But the pro is that it puts out BIG sound! If it will fit where you want it, buy it...if it won't fit where you want, buy it anyway and adapt your space accordingly! I was surprised how good this sounds based on the price and a new no-name (yet!) manufacturer, but the results have been great at low and high volume levels, low watts to 100 watts RMS. You can probably under power these and blow them out, but the more watts they get the happier they seem to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Nice for nearfield monitors
customer_reviews.text: I am using 5 of these for remastering in 5.1 on home PC, using a little eq to tame the midrange anamolies, find these are quite good and detailed overall, when crossed over at 80Hz and used with a sub. Running them with 70 watts per channel. For my intended use as mastering monitors, they are excellent little speakers and I am able to duplicate the characteristics of my main reference system quite well. For use as a main system, they would probably be ok for a small room if placed properly.
customer_reviews.author: tmh355

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely shocked by the quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to describe how well these things are constructed. After reading dozens of reviews, I was sure they were going to sound good. Though I haven't broken them in enough to really get a sense of the sound, I am blown away at the build quality. They look great, and feel great. I seriously can no believe for the price how phenomenal across the board these things are. I purchased the self powered version, which came with all required cabling (3.5mm, AC power adapter, and speaker cables).
customer_reviews.author: Trash Boat

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Polk T15 instead
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why these speakers have received so many positive reviews. They sound flat. They didn't have crisp highs. The bass was distorted. I will be shipping them back. Buy the Polk T15 instead. They are incredible for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robot

customer_reviews.title: Buy mb42x instead of mb42
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy mb42 unless you're installing a crossover circuit. Buy the mb42x instead. Crossover is already installed, and about $10 cheaper than ordering the upgrade. I know this because I just installed the $30 crossover kit on my mb42s and the difference is very impressive. The mb42 sounded thin and a bit tinny.. quite a bit harsher than I was expecting. With crossover installed, they are much warmer, very very nice and easy to listen to by comparison. I'm running an Onkyo amp with Yamaha 8” sub. 100hz crossover between the mb42(x) and sub balances very nicely. I'm now very happy with these speakers and only wish I realized the difference in crossover enough to order the mb42x originally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A reasonably priced center channel for a television setup
customer_reviews.text: I needed a center channel that fit the television console we bought. None of the center channels I had fit in the 6.5" by 15" spot right below the television, but this one fits perfectly with a little space around. Blends in nicely with the black cabinet and I appreciate the magnetic cover on it. The sound from it is very good, with everything being very clear and crisp. I found it a little bright for my setup, so I dropped it down a few decibels on my amp, but it blended extremely well afterwards. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonably priced center channel for their bookshelf or television speaker setup.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good!
customer_reviews.text: I have been designing, building and testing HiFi speakers for over 25 years. The design, execution, and performance of these mini-speakers is nothing short of phenomenal. While the bass limited is to about 60 Hz (with is MUCH better than competing products of similar size), the solid bass, and the clarity of the mid-range and treble is impressive. Good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This center channel speaker was purchased for a second 5.1 system I put together for casual viewing. I was using 4 speakers and a sub without a center speaker. Once I added the speaker, the dynamic range of the movies being watched improved considerably. The sound quality is clean with a good balance between mids and highs. Voice frequencies were exceptional (mind you, I have a decent receiver.) I can't see using this for a large room or on an expensive system, but for small rooms and on a decent receiver this speaker does well. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestilskin

customer_reviews.title: Best bet for the price range
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Logitech's in the $100-$150 price range since ~2008. After my Z-2300's finally started giving out, I figured it was time to upgrade to some big-boy speakers. I didn't feel like finding an amp for the MB42X, so the PB42X fit the bill. Also, I didn't want a sub since it makes listening in an apartment setting more complex. Long story short, I'm VERY happy with these for $120. Great build quality, very sleek looking, and they sound amazing for their price. The best part? Turn them up and really hear the separation start to unfold. Plenty loud, vocals sound crisp and true, and they have enough oomph for plenty of types of music.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: For the price and size, this bookcase type speaker works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of these and they work very well for low to moderate sound; I don't play music at high volume, so can't comment on how these will work at higher volumes. I have a set hooked up to my jukebox and another to a TV. One caveat, if you plan to mount on speaker stands, these do NOT have any way to connect/attach to stands. I had to attach mine with Velcro after gluing a larger platform to sit it on. The flat attachment supplied with the speaker, which is used to secure other speakers that attach at the bottom, is only about 2" square.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Solid bookshelf speakers with decent low end.
customer_reviews.text: These are solid little bookshelf speakers. Surprising low end to them. Ideal for when you want small speakers and don't want to have to deal with a subwoofer. Now don't get me wrong, they won't shake windows with their bass. But for tiny bookshelfs, I was surprised. I use a pair of these in the workshop where I don't want to install a sub and they get the job done just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob BTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: My amp has the capability to set the frequency response and volume levels for good balance. The end result is what I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to upgrade my system to 7.1. I read some independent reviews of these speakers before purchasing them. Most of the reviews I saw were very positive so I decided to give them a try. I connected them to my receiver as side speakers using C&E 14 gauge solid copper wire. My amp has the capability to set the frequency response and volume levels for good balance. The end result is what I was hoping for and expecting. Listening/watching a Blu-Ray movie with 7.1 DTS is awesome. My original 5.1 system uses a full set of Celestion home theater speakers. These speakers compliment the Celestions well.
customer_reviews.author: Tazio57

customer_reviews.title: Great little units, happy purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some blown satellite speakers in my work area for a 'value' 2.1 music system. They snapped in without problem and their quality is great with noticeable improvement in mids and high clarity and presence. I was really happy with being able to hear many details I was previously missing from the cheapo sats they replaced. They are really nice little speakers, and in an appropriate setting provide great value.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Abbot

customer_reviews.title: a worthy upgrade....
customer_reviews.text: I've had a JBL surround sound system for a long while and finally my front surround speaker hit the floor one too many times and started buzzing. I bought the center channel and the two bookshelf speakers to match and they blow away what I had out of the water. Way more punch and detail than what I had, I could not be happier. Solid, heavy build with an in home satisfaction guarantee you cannot go wrong with these. I still got my sub for the deep bass but for a surround set up these are nice and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chumney

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for Great Price...
customer_reviews.text: Really like this center speaker after looking at Polk and Yamaha and a few others. For the price you really can’t beat it, but because of the price I was cautious, because I have a very nice in-wall surround system (but my current in-wall center is now blocked by furniture). I was worried that an expensive system with a cheap center would ruin the sound.... it didn’t. I was worried that maybe it wouldn’t keep up with the other speakers or that the construction might be cheap, but to my surprise the center speaker sounds good, the construction is solid, it’s a fair weight and the wood is finished nicely. Love how the black mesh cover is magnetically attached.
customer_reviews.author: dove

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for inexpensive speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to test out some 25 yr old equipment. They worked on my first test, using 1980s connection hacks (melting wire sheathing with a flame lol). The sound is decent. Not super "hifi" sound, but really good for the size and price. Mozart sounded great as did rock & roll. My bigger issue is getting old equipment to work. Will eventually be replaced once all equipment is tested and a "non-bluetooth" surround set is found at a reasonable price...but will still find a use for these.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass this up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the MB42-C about a year ago. I couldn't have asked for a better center. I replaced a Realistic that had the foam surrounds rotted out. I wanted to replace my fronts with the MB42s. Then saw a youtube review on the MB42Xs. So I had to have them. And why not replace the MB42C with the X? The crossover really makes a difference. I made the mistake of watching Saving Private Ryan.... The bullets felt like they were wizzing past my head! Recently I bought the COVO-S for the rears. Haven't hooked them up, but I know that they're gonna be great!
customer_reviews.author: Stingerssx

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product because of all the glowing reviews. Upon connecting them to the system in the front I noticed they were high end heavy and were lighter on the low end. I expected this as it is only a 4" driver. For a desktop setup this would be great as they will take all they power you can give them and they are smaller in size. Ultimately I am using them as surround channels and they provide all the detail I need in the rear. and respond perfectly. I would recommend this speaker to anyone who is looking for good quality but won't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Grapes2ine

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Crisp Dialogue and Outstanding Sound
customer_reviews.text: This is a great center channel speaker! I retired an 8-year-old Polk Audio CS1 because dialogue often seemed muddy and hard to understand. Replacing it with this Micca made such an astounding difference. Voices are now sharp and clear even when soft spoken. What's more, music sounds better too. It mates perfectly with the rest of my system: Pioneer Andrew Jones front towers and subwoofer, Polk Signature surrounds, Onkyo rear surrounds, Yamaha AV receiver. Surround sound is now near perfect. Don't think twice. Order it now!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: THE  SPEAKERS  TURN  YOUR  LISTENING  ROOM  INTO  A  CONCERT  HALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: These "book shelf" speakers are well made...replaced my large speakers...and I enjoy them so much, I wanted to get a second pair....for that "quadraphonic sound". Unfortunately AMAZON doesn't know when they will be back in stock...or offered again at all? Back to the speakers....These are great bookshelf speakers... that are an excellent investment, and you can tell the quality of the company by the quality of their products...even the way they are shipped...solid box...tightly packed inside...sturdy box...they are shipped in. I am on Amazon's email waiting list...I hope these speakers are back in stock, and offered again real soon. The cost at about $80.00 for the pair...in my opinion...are an excellent investment for your home stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my office and they are phenomenal. And they get better with time. I can't crank them loud very often of course, as my office is adjacent to our lobby. But the deep rich sound always catches everyone's attention. My Chief Engineer was convinced I was running a subwoofer under my desk. I have them on a credenza off to the side and we have all gotten a lot of joy out of these little jewels. WELL worth asking price. These would be great for an average home theater setup too.
customer_reviews.author: Doy Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: A Great Small Bookshelf Speaker for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A great speaker for the money. They sound and look nice. Keep your expectations in check on low bass and ability to fill a large room and you will not be disappointed. If you are using for background music or a small office or bedroom they can be powered by as few as 15 watts per channel. If you want more, please connect to an amplifier with at least 30 watts RMS or you will experience distortion at medium and louder volumes. If you really like bass you will need to pair with a subwoofer or two and will need to manage the signal so the MBs are not pushed below 80 Hz.
customer_reviews.author: Dana sloane

customer_reviews.title: Good Bookshelf Speakers, But Not As Good As Their "Little Brothers".
customer_reviews.text: Good, small bookshelf speakers that sound a little bright at times and lack the bass of their "little brother", the Micca Club 3 speakers. They are more efficient and a have a tad less harsh sound than the Club 3's, but if one has the amplifier power (at least 40 to 50 watts per channel into 8 ohms resistance) my choice of the two is the Micca Club 3 speakers. The bass from the Club 3's is much better than from the Micca MB42X speakers and they sound like a speaker double their size when supplied with sufficient amplifier power. Both are very good speakers for their price, but I prefer the Club 3's over the MB42X speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: a value buy
customer_reviews.text: these speakers are an excellent value/bang for the buck. i am comparing these to the original audioengine A2+ speakers i had. the A2+ 's cost a hundred dollars more, had good sound, but after 5 years started crackling and popping, so threw them away. so, the A2+ 's were much smaller, had better treble, but worse bass and soundstage. the micca 's are more transparent. i cannot really rate them on durability, if they last 5 years and i plan to rate them 5 stars for durability. fyi, removing the grills is supposed to improve the high end.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: They are not bad speakers, but if using by themselves they are ...
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed as the reviews said i would be. They are not bad speakers, but if using by themselves they are pretty lifeless. I am running them through a Onkyo A-9030 and have let them break in for at least 30hours. The mids are tight, the bass is decent around 80hz. The highs even with the grills removed are a bit low. I have a pair of dayton B652 that i did some modifications on and i think they are much fuller and present a wider soundstage. I wouldn't say these speakers are bad by any means, but if using as a pair alone, you might want to look at some other speakers.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace speakers in my home theater surround system...specifically I needed a decent center speaker. I decided on these even though I initially was shopping for a single. At first the sound had little depth but was acceptable. After the break in period,which took perhaps a few days,the sound became more what I had hoped for,and frankly better than I expected. I will be odering more for the front and rear surround. These arent top of the line but if you are looking for quality sound at a bargain price I doubt you will find a better option. I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I hesitated because they seem too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised by these speakers. I bought them based on the Home Theater sub-reddit reccomendation. I hesitated because they seem too good to be true. I've had them up for about a week and have watched 4 movies and had some Spotify going. Really impressed with the sound produced by them. Great, clear, crisp sound. They look really nice as well. Love that the grills are on with magnets so you can decide to leave them off or on easily and they look good either way. Great entry level speakers for a great price. Don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Muhle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Speakers, Active yet Still Need Pre-Amp for Turntable
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of speakers I've bought for my turntable setup. These unites use a speaker wire cable to connect to the Left speaker via "banana plugs". You will need an extra RCA cable to connect from the pre-amp for your turntable as the speakers' volume knob doesn't go higher than maybe 60Db when plugged into a turntable. But with other devices like the auxillary cable (included), the sound goes much louder because those devices have internal volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to get home!
customer_reviews.text: My Micca MB42X speakers arrived on time and they were packed extremely well! Setting them up was a breeze and they sound great as my main surround sound front speakers. I also am using a Sony powered sub woofer to handle the extremely low bass. These Micca speakers don’t get in the way of great movie sounds, rather they disappear in the background and all you hear is natural sound the way it should be. Unobtrusive and natural the way movies were meant to be heard! Overall very happy and love watching all those old dvds that are the bookmarks of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: They're unquestionably better than the larger
customer_reviews.text: Just plugged these in. They're unquestionably better than the larger, bassier set of Kenwoods I got from a thrift store. At first I thought they had no low-end, then I realized the Kenwoods were all muddy and my subwoofer wasn't working properly. Once I got my subwoofer sorted out the difference was night and day. I can actually hear guitars and high-hats now! I also just ordered the crossover upgrade from Micca. Looking forward to having these little guys sound even better. My only gripe is with Amazon sending these in just the speaker box, no covering or anything. That's like an invitation for package thieves to get a new set of speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Adultman

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile but I care enough about sound that a 2.1 system in a box from Logitech isn't "good enough". I use these with my pc for gaming and music and they're pretty awesome for the price. To the average consumer I'd say they realistically sound five times better than any 2.1 system in a box that I've heard, even ones costing $200.
customer_reviews.author: Jake T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rear Surround Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have these paired with my Elac F6 and C6 speakers and they all work perfectly together. They are awesome for the price. I did have to drill a hole in the back (i emailed their support team and asked where I could drill it) in order to install them to the walls. But it worked out great and didn't affect the sound at all. They are small and pack a punch for rears.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron

customer_reviews.title: Good old Days
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Back in the seventies with all the electronic brick and mortar stores you could not buy a set of speakers like this for comparable money. The technology today is so much better than those times. This kind of speaker did not exist. It might have but would have been an exotic piece from England or Canada and be priced accordingly. So thank you Micca for producing a wonderful sounding speaker that is an outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastics under the radar product
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the best center channels under $300. Build quality is solid , small form factor, sound reproduction is spot on(does take a bit to break it in). I also loved the fact that this had hollow banana studs, meaning I could back mount instead of the normal angle mounted plugs. For those of you that don't have a lot of space, this is your speaker. I will point out we have a large living(14x20) and its pushing the limit of what this speaker fill. Again a fantastic speaker, but probably best for small to medium rooms.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a subwoofer these speakers are absolutely incredible. I recently got into the speaker scene and this was my first choice. The sound is so clear, and doesn't distort at high volumes. I would highly recommend these speakers for anybody on a budget who is looking for excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sound
customer_reviews.text: Hey I'm not a speaker expert but WOW. I replaced two JBL's that were two out of six hit by a lightning surge, they were wonderful before but crackly after, cost to replace was outrageous so I opted with these babies & am not disappointed. Yes they are in a smaller room but I think will perform well in a larger area. Totally happy & if the other JBL's start crackling I'll definitely purchase more of these Micca's! Oh a little bigger then I imagined, no complaints thou.
customer_reviews.author: purplecat26

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is more pleasant than receiving an electronic product that arrives " doa ".They powered on,however, there was no sound from either of the inputs.This junk is going back to Amazon.I tried their mini to mini cable and two of my own one being a mini to mini cable that is better quality and a mini to rca.I know both cables work.Now I will have to yet wait again for the replacement.I realize sometimes things like this will happen.One star for you Micca !
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Good bandwidth, nicely balanced response over the most important frequencies. Nothing objectionable with the bass; male voices don't sound like they're coming from the bottom of a well. These are not high output speakers but at old person output levels they are fine. They can crank up a bit too. I have two full size systems which are in a different class than these Miccas, but I find the Micca to be quite satisfying. And at such a low price too.
customer_reviews.author: Knotmename

customer_reviews.title: and they sound very nice for the entry-level audiophile
customer_reviews.text: Currently using these with an AT-LP120-USB, and they sound very nice for the entry-level audiophile. The bass of it leaves some wanting more, but I was honestly surprised with how good it comes out just as they are. Controls are simple, the hook ups are easy, and the magnetic covers are a fun little bonus. If you use these for a turntable (which is why I got them), make sure to get stands. Some electronic songs or other bass-heavy albums/songs can make the surface noise very audible when the record is playing. All in all, I like what I hear and I'll be using them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C.

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price and size
customer_reviews.text: I used these speakers for a small retro gaming setup, so I can't speak too much about the quality when playing music or video files. However, let's just say that these speakers make old Nintendo and Genesis games sound better than I've ever heard before! I run them through a small external ampthat is putting 20w out per channel and I can crank the volume so loud that my neighbors might complain. I haven't heard any distortion or other sounds that would ruin the experience. Pretty solid speakers for the price and perfect for any small-ish sound project.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hann

customer_reviews.title: Great bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for small, inexpensive bookshelf with pretty amazing sound you've found them. Paired with the matching center (MB42X-C) for TV watching they produce very good bass, and have sound definition. Conversation is very clear. For music listening mid-range is very good, high sharp and bass is good without being booming or muddled. They are even well made! For the price I rate them an excellent buy. At any price for bookshelf they are still good. I am very happy to have discovered them.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Caron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget powered bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some new speakers for my new audio setup, as my old PC speakers stopped functioning (and I didn't want to bother fixing them). These fit the bill quite nicely within my budget, as they're powered (so they don't require an external amp) and came with all I needed to set them up quickly. These speakers are nice and compact, which is great because my space is really limited. They sound great, reaching frequencies I honestly didn't expect from a 2-speaker setup. This is definitely an upgrade from normal PC-branded speakers. Would recommend these to whoever is looking for a quality, budget-minded set of bookshelf speakers to start their audio setup with.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Thai

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, crossover is necessary to me
customer_reviews.text: They are a higher quality then computer speakers, maybe compete with my Yamaha speakers, I wouldn't bother getting the ones without the crossover, you would hear the difference, I have the powered by a Fosi 160watt amp and a Fosi tube preamp going into my dj mixer to a set of turntables, high end dj equipment, they can get low frequency but I got them for more mid to high, where the crossover shines.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Recommendation for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review to add a recommendation for anyone using these with a Mac. When I first installed these, there was way too much bass, and Mac doesn't have a native equalizer (probably because an equalizer could damage the speakers on some models). I ended up solving this using a free third-party equalizer for Mac called eqMac2. Use this to adjust the low end down a bit, and the high end up a bit, and you'll achieve a great sound with your Mac. You can find it online easily, and if you're a software engineer you can also find their source code on GitHub.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Really Really Really Good! A hidden bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Really Really Really Good. Best Bang for the Buck speaker I have ever owned. Unbelievably nice. Clear highly directional tweeters. The solid Bass was a bit heavy (because I have a sub-woofer) and I turned it down with the EQ. Most people would like the Bass as it is. Halfway is too loud for my apartment and my ear drums, but clear of distortion. I am using the Micca MB42X Speakers as the front L/R pair on a 25W per channel Logitech G5.1 PC surround system. The Logitech is plugged into a Soundblaster Z series PCIe audio card. A good audio card made the Micca's sound much sweeter.
customer_reviews.author: Cort Byron

customer_reviews.title: Great entry audio equipment
customer_reviews.text: The day I got these, I took them over to a friend's house (as I didn't yet have a receiver) to test them out. His bookshelf speakers were about five times as expensive as these (and twice as big), and the closeness of these in comparison really pissed him off. I enjoyed that. That was about three-four years ago. I've since upgraded my setup, but they were fantastic when I used them. Great quality all around, from sound to build. I recently let a friend have them, and can say they are still as great as they were at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: damn son
customer_reviews.text: these sound great in my room 👌🏼 easy to install, with speaker wire and banana plugs. using an audio technica turntable 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: roland

customer_reviews.title: For the price these guys work pretty good. They do sound a little heavy on ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price these guys work pretty good. They do sound a little heavy on the high end of the spectrum, but I pair them with a couple speakers that sound a little heavy on the low end of the spectrum so it balances things out nicely. If you're expecting them to sound like Bose you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Passives
customer_reviews.text: I'm by no means an Audiophile or an expert, but if you're buying passives, you knwo what you're looking for. Good, high quality bookshelf speakers that are going to be leagues ahead of any sort of powered logitech or normal computer speakers. These things are epic. I own a pair of Pioneer SP-BS22's which are a gold standard, and these hold up right next to them for this price range. The bass is great, and with a good amp, you can definitely drive some great bass EDM tracks or trap music. Also great for playing games. Overall, excellent speakers, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Rashba

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for multiple uses.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the COVO-s as rears for my surround system for about three years. I purchased the powered version of these for my computer when my Klipsch system died. I liked those so much, I replaced my COVOs with these on my main system. They would be fantastic as stand alone speakers as well. I use the powered versions in a bookshelf, and the bass port really does its job. These are in a more open position so the bass is not as strong, but I can tell you the response graph on my system is a lot flatter now than it was with the COVO. Recommend all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought the MB42X to replace a pair of Bowers & Wilkins 685 S1 ($650 /pair), to save space. I use them as my desktop audio solution with a Dayton Audio DTA-120 amp and a FiiO X3 DAP. These Micca MB42X speakers sound great!!! I don't miss the B&Ws at all. I did a lot of research I am glad I chose the Micca.
customer_reviews.author: Just An Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the sound.
customer_reviews.text: I'm always a little nervous on stuff like this. I was surprised. They look good. They sound great. The bass isn't incredible but for the size, they aren't bad. I'm driving them with a small Pyle speaker amplifier. They sound way better than any Bluetooth speaker if twice the cost. The material appears to be quality. Well built. Mid range is good. Volume is good. Tweeter is fantastic. For they price, they can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: ... not an audiophile by any means but these sound FANTASTIC to my ears
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile by any means but these sound FANTASTIC to my ears. I hooked them up in the living room, at ear level and far enough apart to get a good stereo effect going, as per the instructions. They're currently hooked up to an Audio Technica LP120 turntable and also my TV. Music comes through very crisp, clear, and powerful at high volume. The sound fills my small living room and the volume can go much higher than I have it set at. Bass and treble seem well balanced, but you'll want a subwoofer if you want more bass. I live in an apartment building so subwoofer is out of the question for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good. The low frequencies aren't as weak as I thought they would be. They get pretty loud, loud enough for an apartment setup anyways. I'm not an audiophile of any sort but these speakers are awesome. I have only had them for about a week so I can't speak on how durable the speakers are. I'm considering a second pair to use as PC speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Rando

customer_reviews.title: MB42x + Griffin Twenty + old powered sub + Chromecast Audio = goodbye Sonos and hello extra cash
customer_reviews.text: After being disappointed with the Sonos Play:5 (2nd gen) these MB42x speakers coupled with a Griffin Twenty Amp (see link below) and a Chromecast Audio means I am very happy. Also I used an old Onkyo 8" powered subwoofer connected to the sub out of the Griffin Twenty. I am probably the only person not happy with the Sonos Play:5 2nd gen, but I found the Sonos iOS app lacking especially when using Spotify, issues with signal drop occurred (not as bad as airplay though) and the sound quality wasn't worth the Sonos price tag. With my new setup I can get whole house audio, that has better separation with fuller sound and use the actual Spotify app in iOS.
customer_reviews.author: Splat Matt

customer_reviews.title: Maybe i'm the anomaly
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I happened to get a bad one, but right out of the box mine sounded very buzzy (as if the speaker was blown). I'm going to return it. The build quality seemed good and it was packed well. Someone said this was in the same quality/sound category as a SONOS... even if mine sounded clear and crisp, I'd have a hard time believing it would rival a SONOS.But, for $50, it's possible this is a good speaker and I just got a bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: mathiasparks

customer_reviews.title: A great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time. Packaged neatly and securely with dense closed-cell foam. Includes all necessary cabling, although I would have been a little happier with a longer power chord. Set up is super simple, I don't have an amplifier yet and it just connects with a 3.5mm jack to my PC. Sound quality is excellent even without an amplifier. They're loud and needed no adjustments at all. It's been about two days, so I only rated three stars for durability, but I'll be back after I move house in a few months to update.
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Sound is impressive for size and number of elements and price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son and now I want a pair! My son has theses hooked up to a small cheap 100W 2ch amp. Walking by his room you would swear he had a much bigger system with a sub. The bass is very impressive for the size (tight and strong)! The high and mid range are very clear. To top it off they look awesome! I have been involved with music production and sound reinforcement for many years - I know a good speaker when I hear one. NOTE: make sure you give them the power they want. Your amp should be able to output 75 Watts or more to get these speakers to get the best sound experience.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Winn

customer_reviews.title: They're decent for the price, but don't live up to the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I like them well enough. I honestly think many of these high praise reviews are from people who didn't grow up with CDs and stereos, but rather compressed MP3s and crappy computer speakers or the odd Bluetooth speaker here and there. I had all in one stereos (radio/cd/tape/speakers) as a teeanger with speakers with more clarity and oomph than these guys with a mid-range Onkyo receiver. Several folks have reported they sound "tinny" and I am inclined to agree. If paired with a small sub-woofer and placed strategically, these can suffice for what i paid though.
customer_reviews.author: zorg

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, good quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my living room after researching bookshelf speakers for a few days (reading reviews, watching videos). I'm very happy with the look and sound. By themselves, they provide a pretty decent sound for a small/medium sized room. Paired with a subwoofer, the sound almost fills the entire apartment. These aren't for high-spending audiophiles, but they're a great value for everyday listening.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: VERY narrow tweeter dispersion.
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was very impressed with this speaker. The bass was tight and full sounding. I've been breaking it in for 3 weeks now and only started using it for my home theater center channel recently. The first thing, I noticed was how narrow the tweeter's dispersion was. You can only hear the high frequencies when you're sitting directly in front of the speaker!!! A little to the side and it sounds muffled, which does not work in the room I was planning to use it in. I haven't decided whether to return this yet since I may have a use for it in another TV room where we mostly sit directly in front of the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT center channel speaker
customer_reviews.text: After 7+ years of playing music/tv a bit too loud thru my home entertainment system my original center channel speaker started to distort the bass sounds. I replaced it with Micca a MB42X-C center channel speaker and am extremely satisfied. The sound quality is outstanding, and I'll now be replacing the front bookcase speakers with Micca MB42X Bookshelf Speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Marino

customer_reviews.title: Surprising sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and the sound quality is very nice for such a small speaker. We put them in our Motorhome for use with our radio. While I was wondering if the bass would be sufficient we found it is not an issue. We prefer the the sound without adding extra bass. Look good and work excellent. Plastic covering on the case can be damaged if you put a lot of pressure on it, my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great easy listening speakers
customer_reviews.text: Powered by a 2 channel 100w amp and sourced from the TV rca audio output. Placed on a shelf aprox 4ft apart. Clear audio and great mid-range. Bass is not deep or wall shaking. Any music with low range bass doesn't handle well. Easy listening/pop/salsa all sound great. Hip/hop and rap (post malone) are not suitable for the speakers at the same volume as other music. The quality of the speaker and enclosures are very nice and solid. I would recommend a subwoofer with an amplifier with crossover capabilities to manage the amount of bass to the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for near-field listening
customer_reviews.text: I bought these several months ago to place on a desk for using while reading and working. I have them hooked up to an inexpensive Yamaha AVR and a record player that I also got from Amazon. I added a yamaha subwoofer later to add a little punch. I must say that I really, really love the sound of these little speakers. I have a much better system in the den but I find myself gravitating to the office setup because these speakers just sound do good. It's amazing how good small speakers have gotten, and these are a wonderful value.
customer_reviews.author: CTB

customer_reviews.title: This speaker now packs excellent clarity with vocals and deeper bass than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this and then bought mica crossover upgrade for $20 on their website. I am a first time user and it took about 45 minutes to complete the installation. Hardest part was figuring out how to remover the speaker drivers from the cabinet, as even without screws they are tightly wedged in. Ended up jabbing a screwdriver into the paper-thin gap to pry them out and chipped the wood a bit. Wow, what an upgrade from TV audio, though! This speaker now packs excellent clarity with vocals and deeper bass than I expected on an altogether $45 purchase.
customer_reviews.author: levin mattson

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a computer guy buying those pre-made speaker sets from Logitech and the like. FINALLY, I became interested in building my own system from different components and for an entry-level build, these speakers are amazing. HIGHLY touted online for this price range and all the good things that were said are true. These speakers are what I see as an audiophiles entry point
customer_reviews.author: v3n3m

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat the value of this speaker. Look great and sounds quite good. I needed a small center channel to fit my cabinet and this was perfect. Binding posts are a great addition. This replaced an old NHT super-zero I've been using for years and is much louder and clear. Sounds like a whole new system!
customer_reviews.author: SaM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound. Much better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are absolutely AMAZING. I have them running iTunes off an iMac through a Fosi Audio TDA7498E mini stereo amplifier. The sound is just simply amazing. VERY loud with PLENTY of bass and a nice dynamic soundstage. I play a range of music from Soul II Soul, rock, classical. More than happy with this purchase. Highly recommended. The magnetic grilles are icing on the cake
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers under $100 and probably under $300
customer_reviews.text: These really blew my expectations away...perfect bass and treble, amazing soundstage. really packs a punch. superb build quality too. i was initially considering the typical Polk audio speakers as they seem to have the most marketing. but man, this relatively unheard of company, Micca, really puts their money to where it counts: the sound. So glad I made this decision to buy!
customer_reviews.author: eagle

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are extraordinarily rugged and sharp in their construction, it feels like you could take a hammer to the side and the plastic wont break. They posses impactful bass and sharp treble and are appropriately priced for the quality they deliver. I have never heard of micca before, however if the rest of their products offer the same build quality, value and features that this offers, then I will become a loyal customer. They make great computer moniter speakers and if hooked up to a quality manufactured turntable, such as audio technica, they produce very lively and warm music with a steller harmony.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: These sound great. I have a set of Polk tower speakers ...
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. I have a set of Polk tower speakers that I was originally using for fronts, but we moved and now have our TV over the fireplace. I wired the speakers through the wall and wanted smaller speakers to set on the mantel. These sound really good for the price when combined with a Pioneer amp. I am using the Polks for the surrounds and have a Polk sub and a bose center speaker. The MB42Xs sound much better than the Bose center. Eventually I will probably swap that out for something else and I wanted to get the matching Micca MB42X center, but it is too tall for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin T.Top Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: This speaker sounds like I paid atleast $250
customer_reviews.text: I have this for my home theater set up.. It looks and sounds amazing.. Back when I bought it, I paid $19.99... but its worth sooo much more.. I had a Bose Bookshelf speaker as my center channel. But I wanted a dedicated front channel. Well dam, this thing outperforms a lot of high end speakers I have heard. I would recommend this and also I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I had recently moved into an apartment and no longer could have a full surround sound set. I split my set of Klipsch Quintet speakers. 1 center and 2 surrounds in the living room and kept 2 surrounds for the bedroom. Those speakers are fantastic, without a center channel in the bedroom voices were heavily muted and muddled. I added the Micca MB42X-C and it fits perfectly under the tv stand and sounds fantastic. Paired surprisingly well with the other speakers. No need for me to rewind movies again to understand what was said.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: These speakers have an excellent balanced sound with good highs
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have an excellent balanced sound with good highs, pronounced mid-range, and decent low end for their size. Vocals sound natural and music sounds full and spacious. However, a big drawback is that they have significant and annoying audible amplifier hiss while powered on.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Small speakers that pack the perfect punch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers along with the Audio Technica LP60 and those two items were all I needed to play my records, but I've also played my phone through these speakers and it sounds incredible compared to other outlets. These speakers really pack a huge punch!! I've read where people have said that they're more personal speakers meant for filling single rooms but I can hear them well all the way on the other side of my apartment. I highly recommend these as not only do they sound great, but they are also a much less of a hassle than many other audio setups and are a really nice small bookshelf size, making them very convenient and even mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers!
customer_reviews.text: After many, many years of good service my computer speakers (which cost me a fair bit when they were new) kicked the bucket recently. I didn't have a budget to replace them, so I was sure I wouldn't get something that sounded as good. However, on reading reviews for these speakers I was tentatively hopeful. Nothing could have prepared me for just how good they were going to be at this price! Don't get me wrong, these are not anywhere near $500+ dollar speakers, but for $60 you will get something that sounds like it should have cost 3x more. If you're looking for good speakers at a bargain price, this is them!
customer_reviews.author: hellolion

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my TV. The house we bought last year (this one) came with a center speaker and two satellites, but no front speakers. While that set up was functional I knew the sound was pretty thin. Adding the Micca speakers greatly improved the sound quality. Dialog is easier to follow and surround sound is better. While these are far from being the king of bass they are nonetheless substantially better than what I had before. At this price, you'd be hard pressed to find anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speaker in this price range
customer_reviews.text: Sound: I was very impressed with the depth of these speakers. The lows sounded amazing along with crisp mids and highs. Design: I really like these. I know some will say these aren’t a premium build, and I agree, but they boast a simple, yet beautiful design. The carbon fiber woofer also looks great and feels well constructed. Overall, I highly recommend, but remember sound will also be dependent on the amp you choose. For these, I paired with the Fosi Audio BT30C.
customer_reviews.author: Sic

customer_reviews.title: Great bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Fluance record player and I’m not disappointed. Also tested out the aux with my Alexa device and was impressed with the sound quality. Only thing I found a bit annoying was the weak magnets that held the mesh screen over the speaker. I’m worried they may not hold up too well depending on age. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Really good with some EQ Correction
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box they are a bit too colored for my taste. But pairing them with a Behringer MiniFBQ FBQ800 and you can really make these sing. They have really great soundstage and seperation. And bass response is tight and solid once you've applied a bit of correction with the Behringer. Out of the box, they are a bit lacking, though. But for the price they are very good, regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Giovannini

customer_reviews.title: i really like this, was using altec lensing MX5021 for 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: i really like this, was using altec lensing MX5021 for 6 years, before that mainly used my sony speakers with marantz amplifier. Now i just uses lepy 2024A+ with these speakers and it sings! you hear the full range of sound, including deep bass, but deep bass will not be trowing your room in a rumble. but it does it's job so well, i am buying these little boxes again. When listening to Sting When we dance, the voice is clear, the bass is enough, very enjoyable speakers these are. and when watching youtube videos, pod cast etc, the dialogue are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tan

customer_reviews.title: I would and do recommend these speakers to everyone
customer_reviews.text: For the price these speakers cannot be beat. The highs are crisp, the mids are clear, and they put out a sufficient amount of bass without and buzz or rattle. The crossover clearly does its job very well. I would and do recommend these speakers to everyone. I have these hooked to a Schiit Modi Multibit through a Denon HEOS amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a surround system
customer_reviews.text: This is great center channel speaker. I can’t believe how good it sounds with my Harmon Kardon system. It splits the sound perfectly. Great for movies & music. Awesome price. Sounds as good as speakers twice as much. A little bigger than other center channel speakers I’ve had, but that’s what makes it sound so good.
customer_reviews.author: Shana A Miller

customer_reviews.title: MICCA Bookshelf Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use in my 'nostalgic corner' of our dining/sitting room where we are using an old tube amp and united audio turntable to play our vintage records (98, 33LPs, and 45s). These replaced infinity speakers I had for surround theater system. These MICCA bookshelf speakers have larger and cleaner sound with more base. Good value for the money. Packaging was excellent and they arrived in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Seem ok but not as amazing as others seem to think.
customer_reviews.text: I have been hesitant to leave a review on these for a while. I am not an audiophile when it comes to small speakers. I have owned B&O 6 foot tall speakers down to compact bose systems. I bought these at the same time as a set of ELAC B6 Debut Series 6.5" to test out. I just am unable to hear the amazingness others seem to hear. I hope they work well for others.
customer_reviews.author: PMI

product_meta.title: Micca MB42 Bookshelf Speakers, Passive, Not for Turntable, Needs Amplifier or Receiver, 4-Inch Carbon Fiber Woofer and Silk Dome Tweeter (Black, Pair)
product_meta.description: Style:MB42 Standard Bookshelf SpeakersThe Micca MB42 bookshelf speakers render an amazing listening experience while taking up very little in space or budget. Handsomely styled with classic appearance and natural textures, the MB42 is easy to place and blends into any room or decor. Its well balanced sound signature and vocal clarity are a great fit with a wide range of usage scenarios, from background music to home theater. The MB42 design starts with carefully picked drivers that mesh perfectly in the critical crossover overlap region. It incorporates a balanced woven carbon fiber woofer for enhanced transient and impactful bass, and a high performance silk dome tweeter for smooth treble and accurate imaging. The drivers are housed in a ported enclosure that delivers extended bass response with low distortion. Full size 5-way binding posts provide the full complement of speaker wire connectivity options. Hex screws are used throughout for assembly. Hearing is believing. Discover how good an affordable pair of speakers can be by trying them risk free in your home with your music. Place the MB42 along a wall or near a corner of the room for best results. They can be used on desks, book/wall shelves, or on speaker stands. If you are not absolutely delighted with the MB42 performance, simply Return them for a refund. Micca MB42 specifications: - woofer: 4" carbon fiber cone with rubber surround - tweeter: 0. 75" silk dome - enclosure: ported enclosure - frequency response: 60Hz-20kHz - impedance: 4-8 ohms - Sensitivity: 85dB 1W/1M - power handling: 75 watts (each) - dimensions: 9. 5" (H) x 5. 8" (w) x 6. 5" (D)
